messages.content: What nodes are included in the lora-info repository?
The lora-info repository includes 2 nodes: Lora Info and Image From URL.
What are the different methods to install lora-info in ComfyUI?

There are three methods to install lora-info in ComfyUI: 1. Open ComfyUI Manager, search for 'lorainfo', or 'jitcoder', and click install. 2. Inside ComfyUI/custom-nodes, use `git clone https://github.com/jitcoder/lora-info.git`. 3. Download this repo as a zip and extract it in the custom-nodes directory.
What information does the Lora Info node provide?
The Lora Info node shows Lora Base Model, Trigger Words, and Examples.
Who contributed to the development of the Lora Info node?
Special thanks go to `badjeff` for doing all the actual hard work (https://github.com/badjeff/comfyui_lora_tag_loader) and `alessandroperilli` for all the feedback.
Is there a preview image available for the Lora Info node?
Yes, a preview image is available at the end of the section titled 'Lora Info'.
What does the Image From URL node do?
The Image From URL node loads an image from a URL and makes it available for use in your workflow.
Why is the Image From URL node useful in sharing workflows?

The Image From URL node is useful in sharing workflows because it allows users to load images from a URL, making it easier for them to use the workflow instead of having to download images separately.
Is there a preview image available for the Image From URL node?
Yes, a preview image is available at the end of the section titled 'Image From URL'.
